functions

Class AutoToStringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • functions.AutoToStringHelper

  • public class AutoToStringHelper
extends Object
    An immutable String representation of an given object. Objects of this class wrap the data of an object specified during construction automatically using type introspection.

    As an example, consider the Person class outlined below: 

     
     class Person {
         
         enum Gender {
             MALE, FEMALE;
         }
         
         private final String name;
         
         private final Gender gender;
         
         private final int age;
         
         public Person(String name, Gender gender, int age) {
             this.name = name;
             this.gender = gender;
             this.age = age;
         }
         
     }

    Now consider the following code that constructs an object of this class using a Person object as the target: 

    
     Person p = new Person("Daniel", Person.Gender.MALE, 18);
     AutoToStringHelper auto = new AutoToStringHelper(p)
     System.out.println(auto);
    During construction, the auto object automatically maps the identifiers of the all fields in p to their values. The above would print the following: 
    
     Person{gender = MALE, name = Daniel, age = 18}
    It is therefore possible to trivially override the toString method in the Person class as such using an AutoToStringHelper: 
    
     class Person {
         ...
         ï¼ Override
         public String toString() {
             return new AutoToStringHelper(this).toString();
         }
         ...
     }
    Author:
    Oliver Abdulrahim

    • Constructor Detail

      • AutoToStringHelper

        public AutoToStringHelper(Object target)
        Constructs an AutoToStringHelper with the given object as the target.

        This constructor retrieves all fields from the given object using type introspection and automatically adds them into the structure.

        Parameters:
        target - The name for this representation.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the target object.
        Returns:
        A formatted String containing all fields paired with their data of the object specified during construction.
